description.p: Fighters who follow the Path of the Limitbreaker draw upon internal reserves of force, pushing their bodies and spirits beyond mortal limits. Every battle fuels their Limit Gauge, culminating in explosive Limit Break abilities that shake the battlefield.
You possess a Limit Gauge represented by a pool of Limit Dice. You have {{limit dice:amount}} Limit Dice, which are d{{limit dice:size}}s.
You gain 1 Limit Die when:
- You take damage.
- You deal damage with a weapon attack (once per turn).
- You score a critical hit (2 dice).
Limit Dice fuel your Limit Arts and can be expended when casting Limit Magic to add bonus damage equal to the total rolled.
Unused Limit Dice vanish after a long rest.

sheet.description: Gain Limit Dice when dealing/taking damage. Spend to fuel Limit Arts and empower magic. Dice reset on long rest. The number on the sheet is the maximum.

description.p: You learn elemental Limit Magic spells. Constitution is your spellcasting ability for these spells. When you cast a Limit Magic spell, you must expend 1 or 2 Limit Dice and add the total rolled to the spell's damage or healing.

You can cast each spell once per long rest at 3rd level, twice per long rest at 7th, and three times per long rest at 15th. Alternatively, you can expend 3 Limit Die to cast a spell without using one of its limited uses.
Spells known at each tier:
3rd level: Fire, Blizzard, Thunder, Cure
7th level: Fira, Blizzara, Thundara, Cura
15th level: Firaga, Blizzaga, Thundaga, Curaga
18th level: ZetaFlare, Absolute Zero, Judgment Bolt, Full Heal
The saving throw DC for your Limit Magic spells is calculated as follows:
Limit Magic save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier

sheet.description: Learn elemental spells. Cast each 1/day at 3rd, 2/day at 7th, 3/day at 15th. Add Limit Dice roll to damage or healing. Spend 3 Limit Dice to cast without limited uses.

description.p: As part of the Attack action, you can expend 2 Limit Dice to make two additional weapon attacks against the same target. Roll the Limit Dice and add the total to the damage of each attack. If both additional attacks hit, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: Spend 2 Limit Dice: Make two extra attacks. Add Limit Dice to damage. If both hit, target must save or be stunned.

description.p: At 10th level, your Limit Dice turn into d8s. At 18th level, they turn into d10s.

sheet.description: Your Limit Dice turn into d8s.
Your Limit Dice turn into d10s.

description.p: As a bonus action, you can expend 2 Limit Dice to teleport up to 30 feet to a space you can see. If you teleport adjacent to an enemy, you can make a melee weapon attack with advantage against them.

sheet.description: Spend 2 Limit Dice: Teleport 30 ft, make a melee attack with advantage.

description.p: When you score a critical hit, gain 3 Limit Dice instead of 2.

Additionally, once per short rest, when you drop below half your hit point maximum, immediately fill your Limit Gauge to maximum and gain 1 hit point to prevent being downed. If you choose to empty your Limit Gauge after it has been filled, you can use Warp Break as a reaction.

sheet.description: Critical hits give +3 Limit Dice. Once/short rest, dropping below half HP fills Limit Gauge and grants +1 HP. You can empty the Gauge to use Warp Break as a reaction.

description.p: When you expend Limit Dice to deal damage, treat one of the dice as if it rolled its maximum possible value. Additionally, you unlock the final tier of Limit Magic spells.

sheet.description: Spend Limit Dice: Max one die per effect. Unlock ultimate spells at 18th level.
